_source.text: According to a new study by Bettina von Helversen (University of Basel, Switzerland), Andreas Wilke (Clarkson University), Tim Johnson (Stanford University), Gabriele Schmid (Technische Universität München, Germany), and Burghard Klapp (Charité Hospital Berlin, Germany), depressed individuals perform better than their non-depressed peers in sequential decision tasks.

perform **better** **than** their non-depressed peers in sequential decision tasks.

_source.text: According to researchers at Stanford University and the University of Waterloo, both single and coupled people believe their way of life is better and try to recruit friends to follow suit.

coupled people believe their way of life **is** **better** and try to recruit friends to follow suit.
